abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the provincial roads project
            for Argentina were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory,
            the risk to development outcome was moderate, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project: A few
            features that are closely linked to successful
            implementation of the project include the project readiness
            and good quality of designs, encourage borrower commitment
            to the project objectives even during a crisis, effort
            dedicated to efficient coordination and supervision with the
            project coordination unit. A sound and permanent system of
            road financing at the provincial level through a combination
            of user fees combined with financial assistance from the
            central government are required to better plan, program and
            implement road infrastructure management. Unforeseen delays
            in the Bank and borrower administrative procedures between
            project negotiation and loan effectiveness required a longer
            gestation period far beyond regular scheduling.
            Implementation of institutional strengthening program
            required better defined binding agreements between the
            borrower and the Bank. Close assessment of the achievements
            of this project show the need to complement them through
            more results oriented institutional and financial efforts of
            provincial authorities. Severe economic crises pose serious
            challenges for the Government and the Bank to protect the
            poor and indigent households after the crises.

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Provincial Roads Project :
            amendment to the Loan Agreement

abstracts.cdata!:
This amendment to the Loan Agreement
            aims to reassign U$S 12 million of the Provincial Roads
            Project cost savings, to finance priority flood
            rehabilitation works in two medium cities of the Province of
            Entre Rios (originally identified as part of the on-going
            Flood Protection Loan Project), and, U$S 1.25 million to
            finance technical assistance studies on flood protection and
            provincial roads project preparation. This reallocation of
            project cost savings, is part of the measure proposed in the
            Country Assistance Strategy (CAS), to ensure effective
            portfolio management. The agreed revised targets have been
            largely met, and, remarkable improvements were noted in
            project implementation after the mid-term review, whereas a
            recent supervision mission (March 2004) confirmed that with
            the execution of on-going, and recently awarded works
            contracts, the development objectives of the Project,
            including the physical and institutional components will be
            fully met by the Closing Date of December 31,2004, with an
            undisbursed amount of about U$S 20 million. These cost
            savings, are proposed to be reallocated to finance priority
            investments requiring additional funding under the Flood
            Protection Project. The existing action plan has been
            amended to include the new activities, and, is acceptable to
            the Bank.
